title: Schema for Acedeploy SQL solution deployment.json

$schema.title: The json schema for this file.

deploymentMode.title: The deployment mode
deploymentMode.description: The deployment mode describes which steps are carried out in the deployement.

releaseName.title: Name of release (only used if deploymentMode is release)
releaseName.description: The release name is used to create the rollback database clone and to tag the snowflake queries.

parallelThreads.title: The number of parallel threads
parallelThreads.description: The number of parallel threads to be used during some operations, like cloning a database. Note: To open a new Snowflake Session for each thread during the deployment, set the executeInParallelSessions (deploymentOptions) parameter on true.

actionSummaryPath.title: Path to action summary file.
actionSummaryPath.description: Path to save action summary file.

actionJsonPath.title: Path to action json file.
actionJsonPath.description: Path to save action json file, which can be used for smoketest

solutionRepoTagRegex.title: The repo tag regex
solutionRepoTagRegex.description: The regex that will be used to find the latest tagged commit.

solutionOptions.title: The solution options
solutionOptions.description: Set details about the solution deployment options.

ignoreGitInformation.title: Ignore git information
ignoreGitInformation.description: If true, use all files on disk. If false, use only files that have been added or modified since last tagged commit.

stopAtDataLoss.title: Stop at data loss
stopAtDataLoss.description: Stop if potential data loss is discovered.

dropTargetObjectsIfNotInProject.title: Drop objects on target database if they do not exist in solution or if objects are marked as deleted from git
dropTargetObjectsIfNotInProject.description: If true, drop objects that are currently in the target database, but not in the solution folder or if objects are marked as deleted from git (behavior depends on parameter 'ignoreGitInformation').

cloneOptions.title: The clone options
cloneOptions.description: If deployment should be carried out to a clone, use these settings.

deployToClone.title: If true, create targetDatabase as a clone of cloneSourceDatabase
deployToClone.description: If true, create targetDatabase as a clone of cloneSourceDatabase

cloneMode.title: Method by which clone is created
cloneMode.description: Method by which clone is created, only used if deployToClone is true

dropCloneAfterDeployment.title: If true, drop target database after run
dropCloneAfterDeployment.description: If true, drop target database after run, only used if deployToClone is true

policyHandlingCloeExtension.title: Policy handling options - for the interaction with SNOWFLAKE POLICIES pipeline which handles policy assignments separately.
policyHandlingCloeExtension.description: Details for policy handling during the deployment

handlePolicyAssignments.title: Handle policy assignments - for the interaction with SNOWFLAKE POLICIES pipeline which handles policy assignments separately.
handlePolicyAssignments.description: If true, get information about existing policy assignments from a file and alter action statements accordingly.  Note: Can only be used when the parameter reapplyExistingPolicies is set to false! The parameter executeInParallelSessions should be set on true when this setting is used!

policyAssignmentsProject.title: Project/Solution name as defined in the policy assignments config file.
policyAssignmentsProject.description: The name of the project/solution should correspond to a key in the policy assignments config JSON file under Project_Configs.

policyAssignmentsDeploymentDB.title: The database name that is the target of the deployment.
policyAssignmentsDeploymentDB.description: The database name that is the target of the deployment, which is needed for the assignments of policies

policyAssignmentsRole.title: The policy pipeline admin role.
policyAssignmentsRole.description: This role is used as a secondary role to query the DDLs of objects that have policies assigned. It has the 'APPLY MASKING POLICY' and the 'APPLY ROW ACCESS POLICY' privileges.

policyAssignmentsRepoPath.title: Policy assignments repository path on the DevOps agent (checkout version).

policyAssignmentsConfigFilePath.title: File path to the policy assignments config JSON.
policyAssignmentsConfigFilePath.description: Policy assignments are usually defined separately in a file.

policyAssignmentsSaveInfo.title: Option to save the policy assignments information in an output file in JSON format.
policyAssignmentsSaveInfo.description: The policy assignments handling creates a summary in JSON-format of all policy assignments that are handled during deployment. This information can be saved in JSON format.

policyAssignmentsInfoOutputFolderPath.title: Output file path for the policy assignments info (JSON).
policyAssignmentsInfoOutputFolderPath.description: The policy assignments handling creates a summary in JSON-format of all policy assignments that are handled during deployment.

policyAssignmentsCreateAzurePullRequestC.title: Option to display the policy assignments information as comments in a pull request in Azure DevOps.
policyAssignmentsCreateAzurePullRequestC.description: The policy assignments handling creates a summary in JSON-format of all policy assignments that are handled during deployment. This information can be displayed as pull request comments.

resumeTasks.title: Autoresume tasks after successful deployment
resumeTasks.description: If true, resume tasks which were in state started before deployment. Otherwise, they will be suspended if any task in a tree was changed during deployment.

reapplyExistingPolicies.title: Reapply preexisting policies to a view
reapplyExistingPolicies.description: If true, before a deployment, check if there are policies on views. If a view is replaced during the deployment, reapply the policy. Note: Can only be used when the parameter handlePolicyAssignments is set to false!

executeInParallelSessions.title: Execute deployment statements in parallel Snowflake Sessions. Note: Only applies when the parameter parallelThreads > 1 .
executeInParallelSessions.description: If true, the deployment statements are executed in a different Snowflake Sessions for each parallel thread. Note: Should be set on true then handlePolicyAssignments is set on true.

2025-02-clonedViewsQuotes.description: This bug appeared in Febuary of 2025. The field VIEW_DEFINITION of INFORMATION_SCHEMA.VIEWS falsely adds double quotes to the object name after a view with double quotes has been cloned. "S1"."V1" becomes "S1.V1". This setting accounts for that when querying metadata. It will not work if the any of the name parts contains '.' as part of the schema or view name.

keyService.title: The key service
keyService.description: The key service used to retrieve secrets and environment variables.

extensions.title: Extension settings can be added here.
extensions.description: Extension settings can be added here.

preAndPostDeploymentFilter.title: Regular expressions that are not allowed in pre- and postdeployment scripts
preAndPostDeploymentFilter.description: Regular expressions that are not allowed in pre- and postdeployment scripts (regex matching is case insensitive)

snowflakeEdition.title: Snowflake edition
snowflakeEdition.description: The Snowflake edition of the account, defaults to 'Enterprise'.

metaDatabase.title: Snowflake database used as meta databse
metaDatabase.description: The meta database is used to deploy the solution first and the used to compare to the target database. The meta database is recreated each time and will be overwritten.

password.title: Snowflake password
password.description: The snowflake user password. It is adviced to inject this value via the keyService and not store the value in this file directly.

privateKey.title: Snowflake privateKey
privateKey.description: The encrypted private key to connect to Snowflake. It is adviced not to store the value in the file directly.

privateKeyPass.title: Snowflake password for private key
privateKeyPass.description: The passphrase, which would regulate the access to the private key.

role.title: Snowflake user role
role.description: The role used by the user.

warehouse.title: Snowflake warehouse
warehouse.description: Snowflake warehouse used for the deployment.

targetDatabase.title: Snowflake target database
targetDatabase.description: The deployment will be performed on this database.

cloneSourceDatabase.title: Snowflake cloneSourceDatabase database
cloneSourceDatabase.description: If the flag deployToClone is set, this database will be cloned to create the target database.

targetDbRetentionTime.title: Retention time of target databases
targetDbRetentionTime.description: Retention time of target database. This will not set the value on the database, but it is required as an input for the deployment.

tempDbRetentionTime.title: Retention time of temporary databases
tempDbRetentionTime.description: Retention time of temporary databases created during the deployment (such as meta database, target clone database, rollback clone database)

projectFolder.title: Project folder
projectFolder.description: The project folder contains the SQL files.

projectFolderFilter.title: Project folder filter
projectFolderFilter.description: Filenames matched by any of the given filter expressions will not be part of the solution. Patterns are relative to `projectFolder`. Filters use python's fnmatch patterns (https://docs.python.org/3/library/fnmatch.html).

preDeployment.title: Deprecated: Pre deployment steps. Can not be used in conjunction with `preDeploymentSettings` or `postDeploymentSettings`.

postDeployment.title: Deprecated: Post deployment steps. Can not be used in conjunction with `preDeploymentSettings` or `postDeploymentSettings`.

preDeploymentSettings.title: Pre deployment settings. Can not be used in conjunction with `preDeployment` or `postDeployment`.

postDeploymentSettings.title: Post deployment settings. Can not be used in conjunction with `preDeployment` or `postDeployment`.

sqlVariables.title: SQL variables for the deployment
sqlVariables.description: SQL variables for the deployment, given as key value pairs

stringReplace.title: String replace for the deployment
stringReplace.description: String replace for the deployment, given as key value pairs. Only accepts strings

projectSchemas.title: Project schemas
projectSchemas.description: The schemas that are part of the solution. Is used to clone a database. Provide either blacklist or whitelist.

preAndPostDeployment.description: Settings for pre or postdeloyment. Can either be a folder or a single file.

target.description: Target for this pre- or postdeployment. Can be 'targetDatabase' (default) or 'metaDatabase'. Do not use 'metaDatabase' unless you know what you are doing.

enabled.description: Enable or disable deployment of this object type
Enable or disable deployment of this object type

manageTagAssignments.description: Enable or disable managing tag assignments on this object type

quoteColumnIdentifiers.description: If true, quote all column identifiers when generating DDL statements.

enabled.description: Enable or disable deployment of this object type

manageTagAssignments.description: Enable or disable managing tag assignments on this object type

quoteColumnIdentifiers.description: If true, quote all column identifiers when generating DDL statements.

manageRowAccessPolicyReferences.description: Enable or disable managing row access policy references on this object type

manageMaskingPolicyReferences.description: Enable or disable managing masking policy references on this object type

createAndInsert.description: When the new state of a table can not be reached using ALTER statements, CREATE a new table and INSERT existing data. Afterwards, swap the tables.

dropOldTable.description: After the tables are swapped, drop the old table from the database.

useAsFallback.description: In case ALTER statements can not be generated, try to use CREATE and INSERT instead.

updateAutoincrement.description: If a column uses AUTOINCREMENT, try to determine the correct new starting value for the new table. NOTE: If possible, set this to false and use sequences instead.

warehouses.description: If a table contains more bytes than given in the threshold, use the given warehouse. Any smaller tables will use the default warehouse set in targetOptions.warehouse.

byteThreshold.description: Use this warehouse if the tables contains more bytes than this threshold.

keepColumnOrder.description: When altering tables, keep column order. If set to true, this will use additional compute.

enabled.description: Enable or disable deployment of this object type

disabledLanguages.description: Disable specific languages for User-Defined Functions and Stored Procedures

dropOverloadedObjects.description: If true, drop overloaded procedures/functions (with the same name and same reference) before deployment. This option can be used to avoid errors when deploying overloaded procedures/functions e.g. when adding default values for input parameters.
